question: Match the following terms related to the stamen and anther with their NCERT-defined meanings or structures:
column_B: A. Long and slender stalk
B. Terminal generally bilobed structure
C. Attached to thalamus or petal
D. Variable in flowers of species
E. Used to observe stamens clearly
F. Appreciated through diagrams and slides
G. Bilobed structure with two lobes
H. Two per lobe in typical anther
I. Refers to presence of two theca
J. Separates theca lengthwise
K. Found in transverse section of anther
L. Makes bilobed nature distinct
M. Tetragonal in shape
N. Located at anther corners
O. One pair present in each lobe

question: Match the following structures and terms with their correct NCERT-based descriptions or functions:
column_B: A. Develop further and become pollen sacs
B. Extend through length of anther
C. Fill the pollen sacs
D. Microsporangium appears near circular
E. Epidermis, endothecium, middle layers, tapetum
F. Perform protection and dehiscence functions
G. Nourishes developing pollen grains
H. Found in tapetal cells
I. Often possess more than one nucleus
J. Compactly arranged homogenous cells
K. Occupies central region in young anther
L. Cells of sporogenous tissue divide
M. Undergo to form tetrads
N. Result of meiotic division
O. Requires student thinking as per NCERT
